data.title: Woody Allen
data.meta_description: News about Woody Allen, including commentary and archival articles published in The New York Times.
data.text:
Woody Allen, Reputation Bruised, Finds Muted Reception to 50th Film

“Coup de Chance,” a milestone, is being released in the United States after opening in Europe months ago.

By Marc Tracy

‘Coup de Chance’ Review: Woody Allen’s Usual With a French Twist

Despite its Parisian setting, the setup is familiar from any of Allen’s New York movies: An act of infidelity presents a dilemma. Some of the jokes are funny.

By Manohla Dargis

Critic’s Notebook

At Venice Film Festival, Trapped Women and Controlling Men

This year’s lineup includes films from Sofia Coppola, Yorgos Lanthimos and Bradley Cooper in which female characters squirm under the thumbs of egocentric men.

By Jessica Kiang

A French Welcome for Woody Allen, Louis C.K. and Johnny Depp

Under fire in America, Mr. Allen made his 50th film in and around Paris, where he was able to secure a deal, despite the sexual abuse accusations against him.

By Steven Kurutz

The Projectionist

Woody Allen Finds a Decidedly Mixed Reception at the Venice Film Festival

The director premiered his 50th film, “Coup de Chance.” It won over critics but not protesters, who asked organizers to “turn the spotlight off of rapists.”

By Kyle Buchanan

The Projectionist

Venice Film Festival 2023: What to Watch For

New films from David Fincher, Sofia Coppola, Ava DuVernay and Michael Mann will make up for the absence of stars kept away by the Hollywood strikes.

By Kyle Buchanan

Venice Film Festival Lineup Largely Unscathed by Hollywood Strikes

Movies from Bradley Cooper, Sofia Coppola and Ava DuVernay will debut at this year’s event, despite the industry shutdown.

By Alex Marshall

Nonfiction

Face to Face With Culture’s ‘Monsters’

Claire Dederer’s deft and searching book surfaces a “fan’s dilemma” over such figures as Vladimir Nabokov, Woody Allen, Willa Cather and Roman Polanski.

By Alexandra Jacobs
